Long ago, during a time when droves of factories fouled the air with pollution, _____ changed into this form for some reason.
This Pokémon consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air.
It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.
It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian _____, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.
It mixes gases between its two bodies. It’s said that these Pokémon were seen all over the Galar region back in the day.
This Pokémon lives and grows by absorbing poison gas, dust, and germs that exist inside garbage.
_____ alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed, the more powerful the toxins become. The Pokémon also becomes more putrid.

_____ loves the gases given off by rotted kitchen garbage. This Pokémon will find a dirty, unkempt house and make it its home. At night, when the people in the house are asleep, it will go through the trash.
Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small Koffing twins becoming conjoined as a _____.
If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.
Inhaling toxic fumes from trash and mixing them inside its body lets it spread an even fouler stench.
Top-grade perfume is made using its internal poison gases by diluting them to the highest level.
By diluting its toxic gases with a special process, the highest grade of perfume can be extracted. To _____, gases emanating from garbage are the ultimate feast.
Where two kinds of poison gases meet, two Koffing can fuse into a _____ over many years.
When it inhales poisonous gases from garbage, its body expands, and its insides smell much worse.
It lives and grows by absorbing dust, germs and poison gases that are contained in toxic waste and garbage.
Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 Koffings can fuse into a _____ over many years.
